analyzed: lhag ma sems bskyed pa'i skabs su 'di 'dod pa dang / de dag 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i gzhung 'grel pa nyid kyis don rgyas par bstan pas yang 'dir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The meaning of this passage is explained extensively in the commentary, so I will not analyze it here.

original: da ni gang zhig bsdus pa rnams kyi tshig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gang zhig bsdus pa rnams kyi tshig bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the words of the summary.

original: mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dgu bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /üîΩrnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / 'bu can gyi 'du shes dang / rnam par rangs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par @5b dmar ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam par bsdos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dgu bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la / rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / 'bu can gyi 'du shes dang / rnam par rangs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par @5b dmar ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam par bsdos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: ‚ÄúContemplate the nine perceptions of impurity.‚Äù

original: rus pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rus pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The nine perceptions are the perception of a bloated corpse, the perception of a livid corpse, the perception of a festering corpse, the perception of a decomposing corpse, the perception of a corpse gnawed by worms, the perception of a corpse burned by fire, the perception of a corpse cut to pieces, the perception of a corpse carried off by the water, and the perception of a corpse that is a skeleton.

original: de la rkyal pa rlung gis bus pa bzhin du srog mthar thug pa'i rjes la rim gyis lus rgyas par gyur te /
analyzed: de la rkyal pa rlung gis bus pa bzhin du srog mthar thug pa'i rjes la rim gyis lus rgyas par gyur te /
translated: It is like a bellows being blown by the wind, since the body gradually expands after the life-force is exhausted.

original: ma lus par rnam par bam pas na rnam par bam pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus par rnam par bam pas na rnam par bam pa ste /
translated: It is a bloated corpse, since it is completely swollen.

original: de ni dbyibs la chags pa rnams lus kyi dbyibs de'i rgud pa ston pas 'di bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dbyibs la chags pa rnams lus kyi dbyibs de'i rgud pa ston pas 'di bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This meditation should be undertaken by those who are attached to shape, since it shows the degeneration of that bodily shape.

original: gang phyi dang nang dang bar rnam pa du mar 'bus gzhigs pas na 'bu can te /
analyzed: gang phyi dang nang dang bar rnam pa du mar 'bus gzhigs pas na 'bu can te /
translated: It is a worm-infested corpse, since it is eaten by many kinds of worms inside and out.

original: de ni nang khong stong du gyur par snang bas lus rgyas par gyur pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni nang khong stong du gyur par snang bas lus rgyas par gyur pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: This is the antidote for those who are attached to the expansion of the body, since it appears as an internal void.

original: gnas tha dad nas 'dzag pas rnam par 'dzag pa ste /
analyzed: gnas tha dad nas 'dzag pas rnam par 'dzag pa ste /
translated: It is a corpse with oozing wounds, since it oozes from different locations.

original: de ni lus kyi nang dang 'brel pa las dri nga bar snang bas phreng ba dang dri la sogs pa'i dbang las byung ba'i dri la sogs pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi nang dang 'brel pa las dri nga bar snang bas phreng ba dang dri la sogs pa'i dbang las byung ba'i dri la sogs pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: This is the antidote for those who are attached to garlands, scents, and so on, since it appears to have a foul smell in connection with the body's interior.

original: phan tshun du rnam par dmar bar 'thor zhing dgyes la 'dzag pas na rnam par dmar ba ste /
analyzed: phan tshun du rnam par dmar bar 'thor zhing dgyes la 'dzag pas na rnam par dmar ba ste /
translated: It is red because it is scattered about and drips with pleasure.

original: de ni rnam par dmar bas gos shing mi mthun pa'i dngos por snang bas rgyan gyis brgyan pas mdzes pa sha la chags pa can gyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par dmar bas gos shing mi mthun pa'i dngos por snang bas rgyan gyis brgyan pas mdzes pa sha la chags pa can gyi gnyen po'o //
translated: It is beautiful because it is covered with red and is adorned with ornaments that appear as inharmonious things. It is the antidote for attachment to flesh.

original: rnam par gsal bar sngo bas na rnam par bsngos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par gsal bar sngo bas na rnam par bsngos pa ste /
translated: It is livid because it is blue.

original: kha dog tha dad par mtshungs pa'i gnas su zangs kyi mdog dang / rnag 'dzag pa'i gnas su skya ba dang / sngon po'i gnas der phyin zhing sngo ba ras sngon pos g-yogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha dog tha dad par mtshungs pa'i gnas su zangs kyi mdog dang / rnag 'dzag pa'i gnas su skya ba dang / sngon po'i gnas der phyin zhing sngo ba ras sngon pos g-yogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: In places where the color is the same, it is the color of copper; in places where pus oozes, it is white; in places where it is blue, it is the color of a blue cloth.

original: 'di ni ro'i lus kyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: 'di ni ro'i lus kyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: This is the meaning of the term ‚Äúcorpse body.‚Äù

original: de ni pags pa la chags pa'i rgud pa ston pas yul gyi kha dog la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni pags pa la chags pa'i rgud pa ston pas yul gyi kha dog la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: It is the antidote for attachment to the color of objects, because it shows the decay of attachment to skin.

original: khyi dang ce sbyang la sgos pas phan tshun du rnam pa sna tshogs par zos pa ni rnam par zos pa ste /
analyzed: khyi dang ce sbyang la sgos pas phan tshun du rnam pa sna tshogs par zos pa ni rnam par zos pa ste /
translated: It is gnawed because it is chewed in various ways by dogs, jackals, and so on.

original: de ni sha rgyas pa 'jig par ston pas de ni nu ma la sogs pa'i sha rgyas pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni sha rgyas pa 'jig par ston pas de ni nu ma la sogs pa'i sha rgyas pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Since it shows the destruction of the body's flesh, it is the antidote for those attached to the flesh of the breasts, etc.

original: lag pa yang gzhan du /
analyzed: lag pa yang gzhan du /
translated: The hands are in one place,

original: mgo bo yang gzhan du /
analyzed: mgo bo yang gzhan du /
translated: the head in another,

original: rkang pa yang gzhan du sna tshogs par rnam par 'thor bas te /
analyzed: rkang pa yang gzhan du sna tshogs par rnam par 'thor bas te /
translated: the feet in another, scattered in various places.

original: de ni yan lag dang nying lag rnam par 'thor bar snang bas yan lag dang nying lag gi sgeg pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni yan lag dang nying lag rnam par 'thor bar snang bas yan lag dang nying lag gi sgeg pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Since it appears as the scattering of the major and minor limbs, it is the antidote for those attached to the beauty of the major and minor limbs.

original: rus pa nyid ni rus gong ste /üîΩrus pa'i gong @6a * //
analyzed: rus pa nyid ni rus gong ste / rus pa'i gong @6a * //
translated: The bones are the skeleton.üîΩThe bones are connected

original: re sbrel bas tshogs gcig pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: re sbrel bas tshogs gcig pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: in a single group.

original: de ni lus kyi rus pa'i mi mthun pa'i dngos por snang bas so la sogs pa rus pa'i 'byor pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi rus pa'i mi mthun pa'i dngos por snang bas so la sogs pa rus pa'i 'byor pa la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Since it appears as the unattractive thing of the body's bones, it is the antidote for those attached to the beauty of the bones, etc.

original: ma lus pa rnam par tshig pas rnam par tshig pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa rnam par tshig pas rnam par tshig pa ste /
translated: Since it is completely burned, it is burned.

original: de ni pags pa'i dbyibs dang mi mthun par 'khums par snang bas kha dog dang dbyibs la 'dod chags pa rnams kyi gnyen por bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: de ni pags pa'i dbyibs dang mi mthun par 'khums par snang bas kha dog dang dbyibs la 'dod chags pa rnams kyi gnyen por bsgom pa ste /
translated: Since it appears to be contracted, not in keeping with the shape of the skin, it is cultivated as the antidote for attachment to color and shape.

original: lus 'di yang shi ba'i ro dang 'dra'o zhes dang po'i tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: lus 'di yang shi ba'i ro dang 'dra'o zhes dang po'i tshig bzhin no //
translated: This body is like a dead corpse.

original: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bcur gzhan dag 'dod de /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bcur gzhan dag 'dod de /
translated: Others assert ten types of ideation of foulness.

original: rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes ma gtogs pa rus pa rnams gtubs pas rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes te /üîΩtshogs pa'i lus la chags pa'i gnyen por mtshon la sogs pas lus gtubs pas tha dad par rnam par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes ma gtogs pa rus pa rnams gtubs pas rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes te / tshogs pa'i lus la chags pa'i gnyen por mtshon la sogs pas lus gtubs pas tha dad par rnam par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ideation of the scattered is the ideation of bones that are separated by the cutting wind.üîΩThe antidote for attachment to the body as a collection is taught in order to demonstrate that the body is transformed into something different by being cut up with weapons, etc.

original: 'bus gzhigs pa'i srin bu'i 'du shes ni yang lus la bdag tu chags par mtshungs par lta ba'i gnyen por srin bu'i rigs du mas lus khyab pa'i rang bzhin can du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bus gzhigs pa'i srin bu'i 'du shes ni yang lus la bdag tu chags par mtshungs par lta ba'i gnyen por srin bu'i rigs du mas lus khyab pa'i rang bzhin can du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ideation of worms is taught in order to demonstrate that the nature of the body is to be pervaded by many types of worms, as an antidote for the view that the body is similar to the self that is attached to the body.

original: de la dang po rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes nyid yin no //
translated: The first is the ideation of the scattered.

original: gnyis pa yang gnyen por gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang gnyen por gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The second is not the antidote,

original: bdag la chags pa dang / 'jig tshogs la de'i lus su lta ba'i gnyen por mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang / 'jig tshogs la de'i lus su lta ba'i gnyen por mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to attachment to the self and to the view of the body as a whole.üîΩThe ideation of the burned is the antidote to attachment to color and shape.

original: rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes ni kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gdon mi za bar grangs su nye bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes ni kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gdon mi za bar grangs su nye bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is certainly to be mentioned in the enumeration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dgu nyid legs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dgu nyid legs pa yin no ;
translated: For this reason, the ideation of the foul is ninefold.

original: / skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad ces bya ba ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: / skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad ces bya ba ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The eight reflections of a great man are as stated in the sutra.

original: mdo las ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How do they occur in the sutra?

original: 'di ni 'dod pa chung ba rnams kyi chos yin gyi 'dod pa che ba rnams kyi ma yin pa dang / 'di ni chog shes pa dang / rab tu rnam par dben pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dran pa nye bar 'jog pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa chung ba rnams kyi chos yin gyi 'dod pa che ba rnams kyi ma yin pa dang / 'di ni chog shes pa dang / rab tu rnam par dben pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dran pa nye bar 'jog pa dang /
translated: This is for those who are content, very secluded, who initiate effort, who establish mindfulness,

original: mnyam par 'jog pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi yin gyi shes rab 'chal pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi yin gyi shes rab 'chal pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: who are concentrated, and who have wisdom, not for those with faulty wisdom.

original: skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa bdun po 'dis gnas brtan mood gal gyi bu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa bdun po 'dis gnas brtan mood gal gyi bu gnas pa yin te /
translated: The elder MaudgalyƒÅyana lives with these seven thoughts of a great man.

original: bcom ldan 'das @6b kyis kyang mood gal gyi bu skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad po 'di la rnam par rtogs shig /'di ni spros pa med pa'i chos dang / spros pa med pa'i kun dga' ra ba la ltos pa med pa'i kun dga'i ra ba'i tshul dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @6b kyis kyang mood gal gyi bu skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad po 'di la rnam par rtogs shig /'di ni spros pa med pa'i chos dang / spros pa med pa'i kun dga' ra ba la ltos pa med pa'i kun dga'i ra ba'i tshul dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúMaudgalyƒÅyana, you should think these eight thoughts of a great man. This is the way of the forest of the Dharma free of elaboration, the forest of the way of life free of elaboration.‚Äù

original: de la 'dod pa chung bas ni chos bzhi spong ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa chung bas ni chos bzhi spong ste /
translated: One who has few desires abandons four things:

original: 'di ltar tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
translated: hypocrisy, flattery, hinting, and oppressing others for personal gain.

original: de la tshul 'chos zhes bya ba ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de la tshul 'chos zhes bya ba ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: Hypocrisy is as described in the sutras:

original: 'di na 'ga' zhig rnyed par 'dod cing rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa 'dod la sems ltos pa dang bcas pas bcings pas dgon pa par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di na 'ga' zhig rnyed par 'dod cing rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa 'dod la sems ltos pa dang bcas pas bcings pas dgon pa par gyur pa'am /
translated: Here someone who desires gain, honor, and fame, whose mind is bound by envy,

original: phyag dar khrod pa'am /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa'am /
translated: lives in the wilderness,

original: stan gcig pa nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan gang yang rung ba la nye bar brten te gnas pa na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: stan gcig pa nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan gang yang rung ba la nye bar brten te gnas pa na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: wears rags, or practices the single mat, and so on, but does so for the sake of being praised,

original: bdag la gzhan dag gis bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: bdag la gzhan dag gis bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: thinking, ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt it be good if others served me,

original: bla mar byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed /
translated: honored me,

original: mchod par byed /üîΩrjed par byed na ci ma rung /
analyzed: mchod par byed / rjed par byed na ci ma rung /
translated: worshipped me,üîΩand revered me?

original: bdag kyang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa bsgrub par yang bya'o snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: bdag kyang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa bsgrub par yang bya'o snyam du sems shing /
translated: I will also obtain gain, honor, and fame.‚Äù

original: de rnyed pa dang / bkur sti don du gnyer bas rnyed pa la sogs pa'i bsngags pa brjod cing /üîΩtshul de lta bu'i spyod lam la rtog pa 'di ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //üîΩkha gsag ces bya ba ni 'di na gang zhig rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i ltos pa dang bcas pas gzhan dag la 'di ltar khyed ni bdag gi ma dang 'dra ba dang / pha ji lta ba dang / sbun zla ji lta ba dang /
analyzed: de rnyed pa dang / bkur sti don du gnyer bas rnyed pa la sogs pa'i bsngags pa brjod cing / tshul de lta bu'i spyod lam la rtog pa 'di ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o // kha gsag ces bya ba ni 'di na gang zhig rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i ltos pa dang bcas pas gzhan dag la 'di ltar khyed ni bdag gi ma dang 'dra ba dang / pha ji lta ba dang / sbun zla ji lta ba dang /
translated: The term hypocrisy refers to the attitude of a person who is seeking gain and honor and who praises others in order to obtain gain, etc.

original: nye du gang yang rung ba ji lta ba dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: nye du gang yang rung ba ji lta ba dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The term insincere flattery refers to the attitude of a person who, because of his desire for gain and honor, speaks to others in this way: You are like my mother, like my father, like my brother, like my sister, like my friend, like my relative.üîΩYou are like my blood relative.

original: khyed de ltar yin pa des na /
analyzed: khyed de ltar yin pa des na /
translated: Because of this,

original: kho bos sbyin pa la sogs pa yang khyed cag gi don du yin no //
analyzed: kho bos sbyin pa la sogs pa yang khyed cag gi don du yin no //
translated: I give gifts and make offerings for your sake.

original: kho bo ni khyed cag gi don du thag ring po nas kyang khyed kyi thad du 'ong zhing 'dir gnas pa yang khyed cag nyid kyi don yin no //
analyzed: kho bo ni khyed cag gi don du thag ring po nas kyang khyed kyi thad du 'ong zhing 'dir gnas pa yang khyed cag nyid kyi don yin no //
translated: I come to you from far away and stay here for your sake.

original: zhes zer na yang de rnams mang du de la bkur sti mi byed pa na rnyed pa don du gnyer zhing rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i ltos pa dang bcas pas sems bcings pas gzhan dag la tshul de ltar kha gsag smra zhing yongs su smra bas
analyzed: zhes zer na yang de rnams mang du de la bkur sti mi byed pa na rnyed pa don du gnyer zhing rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i ltos pa dang bcas pas sems bcings pas gzhan dag la tshul de ltar kha gsag smra zhing yongs su smra bas
translated: Even though they are not respected by many, they are bound by their minds, which are intent on gain and are attached to the desire for gain, etc. They speak and utter such words to others.

original: dgos pa'i don gyi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i gcam gsag gi las byed pa 'di ni kha gsag ces bya'o //üîΩgzhogs @7a * //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don gyi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i gcam gsag gi las byed pa 'di ni kha gsag ces bya'o // gzhogs @7a * //
translated: This is called flattery.

original: slong zhes bya ba ni 'di na rnyed pa'i phyir dngos po de dang de la mi gsal bar gzhogs kyis rnyed pa'i las byed pa ste /
analyzed: slong zhes bya ba ni 'di na rnyed pa'i phyir dngos po de dang de la mi gsal bar gzhogs kyis rnyed pa'i las byed pa ste /
translated: Flattery is the action of hinting at something in order to get something else, without being direct.

original: lhung bzed 'di ni mdzes zhe'am /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'di ni mdzes zhe'am /
translated: This alms bowl is beautiful.

original: chos gos sam /üîΩsnam sbyar ram /üîΩmal stan nam /
analyzed: chos gos sam / snam sbyar ram / mal stan nam /
translated: This Dharma robe is beautiful.üîΩThis patched robe is beautiful.üîΩThis bed is beautiful.

original: lde mig kyog po 'di ni bzang ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: lde mig kyog po 'di ni bzang ngo zhe'am /
translated: This key ring is beautiful.

original: yo byad 'di bzang ngo //
analyzed: yo byad 'di bzang ngo //
translated: This article is beautiful.

original: gal te kho bos 'di lta bu zhig rnyed na bcang bar bya ba na sbyin pa po yang rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: gal te kho bos 'di lta bu zhig rnyed na bcang bar bya ba na sbyin pa po yang rnyed par dka'o //
translated: If I were to get something like this, I would use it. It is difficult to find a donor like you.

original: gang yang rung ba'i khyim du song nas der 'di skad ces smras te /üîΩkhyed kyi 'bras chan 'di ni bzang ngo //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i khyim du song nas der 'di skad ces smras te / khyed kyi 'bras chan 'di ni bzang ngo //
translated: Having gone to the house of someone who is suitable, he says this:üîΩ‚ÄúThis rice of yours is good.

original: bca' ba 'di ni bzang ngo //
analyzed: bca' ba 'di ni bzang ngo //
translated: This cake is good.

original: gos 'di ni bzang ngo //üîΩkhyed kyi bza' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gos 'di ni bzang ngo // khyed kyi bza' bar bya ba'am /
translated: This cloth is good.

original: bca' bar bya ba 'di ni bzang ngo //
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba 'di ni bzang ngo //

original: gzhon nu'i sa las 'da' bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis de yang dag par bskul nas yang sems can gyi don mngon du byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

translated: ‚ÄúHe wishes to make even a single thought of the wholesome infinite‚Äù means that even a small wholesome root dedicated to great enlightenment becomes inexhaustible until the attainment of perfect enlightenment, as illustrated by the story of the man who dropped a single drop of water into the great ocean.

translated: He does not see form as happiness orüîΩas suffering.üîΩHe does not see it as self or as not self.üîΩHe does not see it as empty or not empty.üîΩHe does not see it as with signs or signless.üîΩHe does not see it as having aspirations or lacking aspirations.üîΩHe does not see it as calm or not calm.üîΩHe does not see it as void or not void.üîΩHe does not see it as afflicted or unafflicted.üîΩHe does not see it as arising or ceasing.üîΩHe does not see it as pure or impure.üîΩHe does not see it as compounded or uncompounded.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //üîΩgang sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no // gang sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa bstan pa ni /
translated: He does not see it as conditioned or unconditioned.üîΩHe does not see it as past, future, or present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: He does not see it as internal or external.üîΩHe does not see it as defiled or immaculate.üîΩHe does not see it as arising or ceasing.üîΩHe does not see it as decreasing or increasing.

original: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rgyus yin pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rgyus yin pas zhes bya ste /
translated: He does not see it as appropriated or unappropriated.üîΩHe does not see it as form, feeling, discrimination, formation, or consciousness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: He does not see it as eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.üîΩHe does not see it as forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, or mental phenomena.üîΩHe does not see it as the earth, water, fire, or wind elements.üîΩHe does not see it as the space or consciousness elements.üîΩHe does not see it as the eyes up to the mental consciousnesses.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He does not see it as the aggregates, constituents, or sense fields.

original: gang kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bstan pa ni /
translated: He does not see it as the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.üîΩHe does not see it as the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, or the path.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi mtshan @19a * //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi mtshan @19a * //
translated: He does not see it as the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the distinct attributes of a buddha.üîΩHe does not see it as the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of paths, or the knowledge of all things.üîΩHe does not see it as the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration

original: nyid med par bkag pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyid med par bkag pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /

analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro /

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //

original: gang kun 'byung la chos shes pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang kun 'byung la chos shes pa bstan pa ni /

analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / shes pa drug la mngon par zhen pa bkag pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /

original: mdo ni gang ji skad du /

analyzed: 'du shes la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: gang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa bstan pa ni /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / chos rnams mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung nas mngon par zhen pa bkag pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The prohibition of attachment is based on the perfections and so on, all the emptinesses, the ripening of sentient beings, the purification of the buddhafield, skill in means, and the nonapprehension of phenomena.

original: mdo ni ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo ni ji skad du /
translated: As a s≈´tra says,

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He does not become attached to the perfection of generosity.üîΩHe does not become attached to the perfection of morality, and so on.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de ni 'di ltar gang mngon par zhen par byed pa po'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang mngon par zhen par byed pa po'am /
translated: Because he who would become attached, the attachment, and that to which one would become attached‚Äîall these things are not apprehended.

original: gang gis mngon par zhen par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis mngon par zhen par byed pa'am /
translated: By what is there attachment?

analyzed: gang la mngon par zhen par bya ba'i chos de dag yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //

original: gang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa bstan pa ni /

original: de ltar spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel te /

original: mdo ni ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo ni ji skad du /

analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par de ltar spyod pa de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par 'phel te zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes gang @19b gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de yang 'gog pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de nyid bstan pa ni /

original: rigs kyi bu legs so legs so //

original: 'di ni don dam pa de la bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa de la bzod pa yin te /

original: gang 'gog pa la chos shes pa bstan pa ni /

translated: They go to the buddhafields and bring sentient beings to full maturity.‚Äù

analyzed: de dag gis 'bring bstan nas chen po brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the medium, now, in order to explain the great,

translated: the text says, Blessed One, if bodhisattvas, without skill in means, practice the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: gzugs la spyod na mtshan ma la spyod kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa nyid ni dmigs pas khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar yang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas sa brgyad pa yin par bstan te /

translated: From the aggregates, etc. up to unmixed and the cessation of abiding, aspiration, and perception indicates that all phenomena are without abiding, aspiration, and perception, and thus are superior in aspect.

analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa de la gnas pa yin zhe na /

original: thabs la mkhas pas de la mi gnas pa'i @29a * //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas de la mi gnas pa'i @29a * //
translated: From the perspective of skill in means, one does not abide in that.

analyzed: dbang du byas nas gzugs la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i bar du bzlog pa la spyod pa bstan te /

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning of skill in means up to the end of the chapter,

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gzugs ma yin /

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs las gzhan ma yin te /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid gnyis phan chun ngo bo nyid gcig par bstan te /

analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar lhung ba las nges par grol ba ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par gsal bar bstan to //
translated: It is clearly taught that liberation from falling into the extremes of cyclic existence and nirvana is skillful means.

translated: And by abiding in the perception of the many illusions of that very [concentration], they are armored in the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a giver, a gift, or a recipient.üîΩThese are the first armoring.üîΩThere are six on the armoring of the perfection of generosity:

original: de dag ni go cha'i bsgrub pa dang po yin pa las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha la drug / de bzhin du de nyid kyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gnyis pa'o //

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gsum pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni drug pa'o //

translated: The vehicle of the bodhisattvas is the cultivation of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment in all aspects and so on.üîΩThe engagement of the immeasurables is the perfection of patience through the patience of the knowledge of all aspects while engaging in the four immeasurables, the perfection of effort through the Great Vehicle of the perfection of effort, the non-mixing of the mind of the Lesser Vehicle,

original: ma 'dres pa nyid dang ; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med pa nyid dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis tshad med pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa nyid dang ; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba med pa nyid dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis tshad med pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the absence of relishing the taste of concentration through the Great Vehicle of the perfection of wisdom, and the meditative equipoise on the four immeasurables through the Great Vehicle of the perfection of concentration.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis sems can rnams zag pa zad par nges par 'dren pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis sems can rnams zag pa zad par nges par 'dren pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa rnams dang /
translated: The Mahayana of the perfection of morality itself dedicates all concentrations, immeasurables,

original: rtags dang / mtshan ma rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rtags dang / mtshan ma rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: signs, and marks to omniscience.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i go rims 'di ni @42b tshad med pa bzhi la gnas pa'i gang zag gi bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i go rims 'di ni @42b tshad med pa bzhi la gnas pa'i gang zag gi bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: This sequence of perfections is from the perspective of the activity of the person abiding in the four immeasurables.

original: de nyid la de lta bu srid pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la de lta bu srid pa shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that such is possible for them.

original: yang tshad med pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang tshad med pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, the immeasurables are four:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la yang de dag re re zhing rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la yang de dag re re zhing rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity. Each of them has three aspects.

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: 1. that which has sentient beings as its object; 2. that which has the factors of existence as its object; 3. that which has no object.

original: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: That which has sentient beings as its object is established by four causes:

original: nye bar bsdus pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid dang / rnam par dag pa nyid dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar bsdus pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid dang / rnam par dag pa nyid dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: 1. its nature as a collection; 2. its nature as the counteragent to the adverse elements; 3. its nature as purification; 4. its nature as the support for the result.

original: ji ltar nye bar bsdu ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bsdu ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a collection?

original: bde ba gsum gyis nye bar bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba gsum gyis nye bar bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a collection of the three kinds of happiness.

original: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde bas nye bar bsdus pa'i don du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde bas nye bar bsdus pa'i don du nye bar gnas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa thought endowed with love‚Äù means that it is present as a collection of benefit and happiness.

original: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde bas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde bas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvast‚Äù means that it is a collection of the happiness of the desire realm.

original: chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat‚Äù means that it is the level of the first and second dhyanas, which are associated with joy.

original: de gnyis na dga' ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis na dga' ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is joy in those two.

original: mi gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Non-dual means the stage of the third concentration, which is free from joy.

original: de ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: It is non-dual because it is free from suffering.

original: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tshad med pas na chu bo chen po bzhi'i chu 'dus pa dang 'dra bar de nyid tshad med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tshad med pas na chu bo chen po bzhi'i chu 'dus pa dang 'dra bar de nyid tshad med par shes par bya ste /
translated: Immeasurable means immeasurable result, like the combined waters of the four great rivers, it should be known as immeasurable.

original: de ltar yang bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that it possesses pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar na re zhig nye bar bsdus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig nye bar bsdus pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, it is included in the formless realm.

original: ji ltar na mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the antidote to the opposing side?

original: gcugs med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcugs med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called non-attachment.

original: mi sdug pas nye bar bsdus pa dang / sdug pas nye bar bsdus pa'i 'gal bar gyur pa gnod sems kyi gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: mi sdug pas nye bar bsdus pa dang / sdug pas nye bar bsdus pa'i 'gal bar gyur pa gnod sems kyi gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: It is the antidote to malice because it is the opposite of attachment, which is included in the unwholesome, and attachment, which is included in the wholesome.

original: ji ltar na rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /üîΩgnod pa med pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par dag pa yin zhe na / gnod pa med pa /
translated: How is it pure?üîΩIt is non-violent,

original: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: non-obstructed.

original: gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin du spangs nas de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin du spangs nas de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having abandoned the obstructions of sleep, sloth, excitement, and regret, one enters into reality.

original: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi rnam par smin pa dang / @43a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya'o // 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi rnam par smin pa dang / @43a * //
translated: The possession of results is called non-violence.

original: rgyu mthun pa gnod pa med pa nyid kyis ci rigs par 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa gnod pa med pa nyid kyis ci rigs par 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The non-violence of the results of retribution and of outflow of the desire realm and the form realm is the possession of results in the appropriate order.

original: de ltar na re zhig sems can la dmigs pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig sems can la dmigs pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the object of sentient beings is established by four causes.

original: chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gcig thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gcig thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The object of dharmas is one, and it is omnipresent.

original: thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa ji snyed pa'o //
translated: The universal object is all ordinary beings and all those in training who experience the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: chos gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is the object?

original: gang dag la sems can du btags par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la sems can du btags par byas pa'o //
translated: It is the sentient beings who are designated as such.

original: de la dmigs pa nyid ni shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid ni shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The object of meditation is the universal object, which is cultivated to a high degree.

original: legs par goms par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par goms par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cultivated to a high degree because it is well cultivated.

original: dmigs pa med pa yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The objectless is also of two kinds.

original: chos kyi dbyings mchog 'jig rten zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mchog 'jig rten zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The objectless is the characteristic of the supreme mundane state, which is called the sphere of reality.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos las bdag med pa gtso bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos las bdag med pa gtso bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme mundane state because it is the foremost of mundane states.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' med pa dang / yongs su chad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' med pa dang / yongs su chad pa med pa ste /
translated: It is unlimited because it is not limited and is not interrupted.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is objectless.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems des ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems des ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does the mind endowed with loving-kindness do?

original: de'i phyir thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he fills and completely pervades the entire ten directions.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lhag pa'i bsam pas lhag par mos pas spros pa nyid kyis khyab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lhag pa'i bsam pas lhag par mos pas spros pa nyid kyis khyab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He pervades all world-realms with his superior intention and superior aspiration. This is the meaning of ‚Äúhe pervades with his emanations.‚Äù

original: ldan pa ni du mar shes par byas te /
analyzed: ldan pa ni du mar shes par byas te /
translated: He is to be understood as having many forms.

original: ma tra la sogs pa mtha' yas pas padma can bzhin du ring po nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma tra la sogs pa mtha' yas pas padma can bzhin du ring po nyid yin no //
translated: He is long like the Padma-holder, because he is infinite like Matrceta and so on.

original: nye bar rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba ni blos de dang der nye bar yang dag par song ste de'i nye bar 'tshe ba bsal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba ni blos de dang der nye bar yang dag par song ste de'i nye bar 'tshe ba bsal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He completely pervades means that he goes to each and every place with his mind and removes their troubles.

original: tshig gi phrad dang / skad kyi dbyings kyi don ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi phrad dang / skad kyi dbyings kyi don ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the verbal root and the verbal base.

original: snying rje la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Compassion and so on should be explained in the same way.

original: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni gang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan par shes pa nyid kyis chos thams cad g-yeng ba med pas mnyam par gzhag par shes pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni gang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan par shes pa nyid kyis chos thams cad g-yeng ba med pas mnyam par gzhag par shes pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
translated: The engagement that possesses nonobservation is the knowledge that possesses nonobservation of permanence, happiness,

original: bdag dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa ma yin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la de dang mthun pa'i shes pa 'jug pa dang / dus gsum mi dmigs pa'i ye shes dang / khams gsum @43b mi dmigs pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: bdag dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa ma yin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams la de dang mthun pa'i shes pa 'jug pa dang / dus gsum mi dmigs pa'i ye shes dang / khams gsum @43b mi dmigs pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: self, peace, nonemptiness, sign, and aspiration and the engagement of knowledge that is compatible with them, the wisdom that does not observe the three times, the wisdom that does not observe the three realms,

original: yang 'jig rten pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas dang / de dang mi mthun pa rnams yang sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa ni theg pa chen po de la zhon pa yin zhes bstan te /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas dang / de dang mi mthun pa rnams yang sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa ni theg pa chen po de la zhon pa yin zhes bstan te /
translated: and the knowledge of the yogi who does not observe the contaminated mundane, the compounded, and that which is incompatible with them in generosity and so on.üîΩThis is the vehicle that they ride.

original: de'i mdo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni 'di yin te /
translated: The sutra says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gang stong pa nyid shes kyang mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gang stong pa nyid shes kyang mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva who knows emptiness but does not apprehend it is called the yoga of non-apprehending.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement of the three spheres being pure

original: gang yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis zhon pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis zhon pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: is taught as the bodhisattva who, practicing the perfection of wisdom, mounts the perfections such as giving and, by the yoga of non-apprehending through the purity of the three spheres, engages in giving.

original: de'i mdo ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la zhon nas byang chub sems dpa' de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa rab tu 'dzin te
analyzed: de'i mdo ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la zhon nas byang chub sems dpa' de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa rab tu 'dzin te
translated: The s≈´tra says, When the bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom, mounting the perfections such as giving, that bodhisattva does not apprehend the perfection of giving...

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung nas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams la sogs pa rnams nas ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung nas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams la sogs pa rnams nas ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, having taken up the non-apprehension of sentient beings, through the knowledge that they are mere names, mounts the Great Vehicle, because he knows that the aggregates of form, etc., the elements, etc., up to the unentangled dharmas, all the emptinesses, suchness, etc.,

original: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas gang yin pa de dag mi dmigs pa nyid nye bar bzung nas ming tsam nyid du shes pa'i phyir theg pa chen po de la de zhon pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas gang yin pa de dag mi dmigs pa nyid nye bar bzung nas ming tsam nyid du shes pa'i phyir theg pa chen po de la de zhon pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: and whatever is enlightenment and whatever is buddhahood are mere names, having taken up their non-apprehension.

original: de'i mdo ni de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i ma 'dres pa'i sems kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom par byed cing bsgom pa dang rnam par bsgom pa'i ched du mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor
analyzed: de'i mdo ni de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i ma 'dres pa'i sems kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom par byed cing bsgom pa dang rnam par bsgom pa'i ched du mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor
translated: The s≈´tra passage is: ‚ÄúHe cultivates the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening with a mind that is not mixed with attention endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, for the sake of meditation, cultivation, and full cultivation, through the yoga of non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: mngon par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni gang gzhan yang mngon par shes pa rnams thob nas sems can yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni gang gzhan yang mngon par shes pa rnams thob nas sems can yongs su smin par byed /
translated: The engagement of the superknowledges is that, having attained the superknowledges, one brings beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong /
translated: One purifies the buddhaverse.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa dang / chos nyan zhing gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas te theg pa chen po dang nam du yang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa dang / chos nyan zhing gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas te theg pa chen po dang nam du yang mi 'bral te /
translated: One makes offerings to the Blessed Buddhas, listens to the Dharma, and, dwelling in the stage of nonduality, never separates from the Great Vehicle.

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su 'dzin pa yin no zhes bstan to //üîΩde'i mdo ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub @44a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su 'dzin pa yin no zhes bstan to // de'i mdo ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub @44a * //
translated: This is the nature of the superknowledges.

original: kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du mngon par shes pa rdzogs pa nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

translated: and the five eyes, and the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ and meditative stabilization, and having remained there, having attained complete enlightenment in omniscience through the teaching of the knowledge of path aspects, and having turned the wheel of the Dharma, they cause sentient beings to attain nirvƒÅ·πáa through the three vehicles.

analyzed: de dag ni gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig ston pa yin pas de dag la ni mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Since they teach only emptiness by way of refuting others, they do not have any order of realization.üîΩThey express only the meaning of the chapters, not the meaning of the treatise.

original: de rnams ni rab tu byed pa'i don kho na rjod par byed kyi bstan bcos don gtso bor byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni stong pa nyid kyi rab tu byed pa'i song ba dang / 'ong ba'i bya ba'i rim pa med pas ched du bya ba las nyams pa srid par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni rab tu byed pa'i don kho na rjod par byed kyi bstan bcos don gtso bor byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni stong pa nyid kyi rab tu byed pa'i song ba dang / 'ong ba'i bya ba'i rim pa med pas ched du bya ba las nyams pa srid par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that since the chapter on emptiness does not have an order of coming and going, it is possible that it is deficient in its purpose.

original: 'dir yang ci rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa ci @47b zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang ci rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa ci @47b zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the object of nonconceptual exalted wisdom?

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ltar gang mi dmigs pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang mi dmigs pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which is not observed does not exist,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: stong pa nyid 'di yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And this emptiness is not perceived by a nonconceptual mind.

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid med pas chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid med pas chos thams cad yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Thus, since emptiness does not exist, do all things not exist?

original: de ni 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This is to be analyzed here.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa dang bral bas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gang zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa dang bral bas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gang zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This so-called emptiness is free from the observation of all things, and it does not exist as anything.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes tsam nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes tsam nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that it is merely nonconceptual wisdom.

original: kha cig ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo cha gnyis pa nyid kyis na cha gcig la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo cha gnyis pa nyid kyis na cha gcig la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that it does not abide in one part because it has two parts, the nature of apprehended and apprehender.

original: la lan re de ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la lan re de ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is the observation of the emptiness of all things by their intrinsic reality.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dmigs par 'gyur ba de ni rmi lam gyi rta la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dmigs par 'gyur ba de ni rmi lam gyi rta la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: That which observes the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of all phenomena is like the consciousness that observes the horse, etc. in a dream, which are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: snga ma'i phyogs gnyis po de dag kyang ye shes kyi dngos po med pa yul du 'gyur la /
analyzed: snga ma'i phyogs gnyis po de dag kyang ye shes kyi dngos po med pa yul du 'gyur la /
translated: In those two former positions, the non-entity of exalted wisdom becomes the object,

original: stong pa nyid 'dus byas su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'dus byas su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and emptiness would absurdly follow as conditioned.

original: phyogs gsum pa la nyes pa yod par mi brjod dam zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa la nyes pa yod par mi brjod dam zhe na /
translated: Is it said that there is a fault in the third position?

original: nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault,

original: gang gi phyir lha sbyin bsad nas yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha sbyin bsad nas yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is not the case that Devadatta, having been killed, arises again.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye ba ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi ye shes kyi tshogs bzhag pa 'di ni phyogs tsam mo //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i dbye ba ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi ye shes kyi tshogs bzhag pa 'di ni phyogs tsam mo //
translated: Although there are many topics to be expressed in the divisions of mirror-like exalted wisdom and so forth, this presentation of the collection of exalted wisdom is merely a fraction.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni gang de la dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni gang de la dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the collection of merit? What is the meditative stabilization of going heroically?

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gang gsungs zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gang gsungs zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the first chapter in the Ornament of Clear Realization, which is the middle one of the three sections on the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe explanation of the second chapter, which is the one on the perfection of concentration, has three parts:

original: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin nas ting nge 'dzin brgya rtsa gcig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin nas ting nge 'dzin brgya rtsa gcig bstan pa ni /
translated: the introduction, the main part, and the conclusion.

original: ji skad du /üîΩnges par 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba dang / nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du / nges par 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba dang / nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The introduction has two parts:üîΩthe homage and the commitment to compose.üîΩThe homage has two parts:

original: go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs kyi bsgrub pa nas brtsams te /üîΩting nge 'dzin bsgom @48a * //
analyzed: go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs kyi bsgrub pa nas brtsams te / ting nge 'dzin bsgom @48a * //
translated: the homage itself and the identification of the homage.üîΩThe homage itself has two parts:

original: pa yin zhes song zin ba dang sbyor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa yin zhes song zin ba dang sbyor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: the actual homage and the identification of the one to whom the homage is made.üîΩThe actual homage has two parts:üîΩthe actual homage and the praise.üîΩThe actual homage has two parts:üîΩthe homage itself and the identification of the one to whom the homage is made.üîΩThe identification of the one to whom the homage is made has two parts:üîΩthe identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body and the identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the mind.üîΩThe identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body has two parts:üîΩthe identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body in general and the identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body in particular.üîΩThe identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body in general has two parts:üîΩthe identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body in general in terms of the qualities of the body in general and the identification of the one to whom the homage is made in terms of the qualities of the body in general in terms of the qualities of the mind.

original: lam gyi tshogs ni gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te bslab pa las 'das pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gnas pa dang / 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam rnams dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs ni gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te bslab pa las 'das pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gnas pa dang / 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam rnams dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang /
translated: The antidote to distraction is the conduct of standing, sitting, and so on, as well as the activities of going, coming,üîΩlooking, and looking away, and the exhalation and inhalation of breath.

original: lta ba dang rnam par lta ba'i bya ba rnams dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa rnams la rdza mkhan gyi dpes ring ba dang / thung bar rab tu shes pa dang / lus kyi gnyen po'i 'du shes ba lang gi shan pa'i dpes bstan pa dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang rnam par lta ba'i bya ba rnams dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa rnams la rdza mkhan gyi dpes ring ba dang / thung bar rab tu shes pa dang / lus kyi gnyen po'i 'du shes ba lang gi shan pa'i dpes bstan pa dang /
translated: The long and short [breaths] are well known through the example of a potter.üîΩThe antidote to the misconception of purity is the examination of impurity through the example of a pot filled with feces.

original: khams rnams la so sor brtags nas gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por chud pa'i snod kyi dpes mi gtsang bar so sor brtags pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang dang / de bzhin du phyi rol dang / phyi dang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas /
analyzed: khams rnams la so sor brtags nas gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por chud pa'i snod kyi dpes mi gtsang bar so sor brtags pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang dang / de bzhin du phyi rol dang / phyi dang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas /
translated: The examination of the internal and external body through the view of the body is taught through the example of a lamp.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa na lus de yang 'di lta bu'i chos can no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa na lus de yang 'di lta bu'i chos can no //
translated: When he is mindful of the body, he sees that it is of such a nature.

original: skye ba 'di'i'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di'i'o //
translated: It is of such a constitution.

original: 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba la gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba la gsungs te /
translated: It is of such an essence.

original: khu ba dang / khrag gi gnas skabs dang / gnas skabs de nyid 'phel bar gyur pa las 'chi ba la thug pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis chos nyid bsgrub pa de la sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: khu ba dang / khrag gi gnas skabs dang / gnas skabs de nyid 'phel bar gyur pa las 'chi ba la thug pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis chos nyid bsgrub pa de la sbyor ba yin te /
translated: He is engaged in the practice of the impermanence of the body, which is established by the nature of things, from the time of the sperm and blood up to the time of its development and its death.

original: tshig gnyis po 'dis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyis po 'dis shes par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood by means of the two phrases.

original: gang yang me la sogs pas mthar thug par byas pa de la yang chos nyid 'di las ma 'das so zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum yin no //
analyzed: gang yang me la sogs pas mthar thug par byas pa de la yang chos nyid 'di las ma 'das so zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum yin no //
translated: And whatever is burned by fire, etc., that also is not beyond the nature of things. This is to be understood by means of the three phrases.

original: gdung can zhes bya ba la stobs zad pa dang / zas gcod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / shin tu ldan pa'i don te /
analyzed: gdung can zhes bya ba la stobs zad pa dang / zas gcod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / shin tu ldan pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù means the exhaustion of strength, fasting, pain, and great affliction.

original: gang de yod pa de ni myur ba'i 'bad pa can no //
analyzed: gang de yod pa de ni myur ba'i 'bad pa can no //
translated: He who has that is one who strives quickly.

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par shin tu rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par shin tu rig pa'o //
translated: He who is ‚Äúendowed with awareness‚Äù is one who has perfect knowledge.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPossessed of mindfulness‚Äù means not forgetting the meditative object.

original: rnam par bsal ba zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsal ba zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDiscerning‚Äù means turning away from.

original: ci zhig las she na /
analyzed: ci zhig las she na /
translated: From what?

original: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang ; yid mi bde ba dag las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang ; yid mi bde ba dag las so //
translated: From worldly attachment and anxiety.
